thread.title: Hero Chris Mintz was shot as he faced Oregon community college shooter
thread.title_full: Hero Chris Mintz was shot as he faced Oregon community college shooter

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Hero Chris Mintz was shot as he faced Oregon community college shooter
text:
An army veteran was in stable condition at an Oregon hospital Friday, a day after facing a gunman during a deadly shooting at a community college in Oregon , Mercy Medical Center officials said. Chris Mintz, 30, was shot seven times, according to Shelly Stefanich, a spokeswoman for Mercy Medical Center.
His family members said he jumped into action to save the lives of people in his classroom, WFMY-TV reports.
Mintz heard gunshots in the classroom next to his and instead of running, walked toward the gunman, according to his cousin, Ariana Earnhardt.
“He told the people in his classroom just be calm. He met the shooter at the door and said to calm down. He tried to talk to him and talk him out of it,” Earnhardt told WFMY-TV.
Earnhardt said Mintz was in the military for 10 years, and moved to Oregon from North Carolina to be close to his son. The 30-year-old tried to keep the gunman from getting into the classroom and was shot three times, his aunt, Wanda Mintz, told KCPQ-TV.
USA TODAY
11 mass shootings, 11 speeches: How Obama has responded
"(He) hit the floor, looks up at gunman, and says, 'It's my son's birthday today.' (And he) gets shot two more times,” Wanda Mintz told KCPQ.
Ten people were killed and seven injured in the shooting at Umpqua Community College . It was the fifth shooting on a U.S. college campus since August of this year.
Authorities say the male shooter — who they have refused to name publicly in an effort to avoid giving him further notoriety — was killed in a shootout with police shortly around 10:30 a.m. Pacific time on Thursday.
USA TODAY
Oregon shooting: Town braces for release of victims' names
"Let me be very clear: I will not name the shooter," Douglas County Sheriff John Hanlin said at an evening press conference on Thursday. "Focus your attention on the victims and their families and helping them recover." Federal law enforcement officials nevertheless identified the shooter as Chris Mercer, who lived in the area.
On social media, the hashtag #ChrisMintz is trending as people share his story and offer support for his family and the other victims.
There has been a push from authorities and many of the victims' families not to use the alleged shooter’s name. One person tweeted, "I haven't seen the shooter's name once, but I know the name Chris Mintz."
I will say this -- I haven't seen the shooter's name once, but I know the name Chris Mintz.
— Daniel Kunka (@unikunka) October 2, 2015 Chris Mintz name is trending. The killer's name isn't. If you want to stop these kinds of crimes. This is a good start.
— Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) October 2, 2015 Others praised Mintz's service to his country and bravery in the face of death.
I'm so PROUD of my brother *ARMY* veteran, Chris Mintz! A ***BIG*** "HOOAH!" to you, brave soldier! #BeAllYouCanBe pic.twitter.com/1Ul61qJdCW
— LTC Hunter (@LTC_Hunter) October 2, 2015 Thank God he survived. Thank you, Chris Mintz, for putting your life on the line to try to save others. Again.
— Vesa, of Harrogath (@VesamoraAIE) October 2, 2015 Friday, Mintz had a friend post an update on his condition to his Facebook page: “This is Chris’s friend, Chris asked me to thank everyone for their support, he is grateful and keeping our community and all victims in his thoughts.” Mintz's family set up a GoFundMe account to pay for his medical bills, and as of Thursday afternoon had raised more than $15,000.

COMMUNITY COLLEGE Oregon shooting: Reports some knew of plan, did nothing | 01:46 Hundreds of people gathered in Roseburg, Oregon to honor the victims of the Umpqua Community College shooting. Students who witnessed the shooting described the scene. Others were angry about reports the shooter told of his plans on social media. VPC

The gunman died in a shootout after killing nine people on a community college campus in Roseburg, Oregon on Thursday. (Oct. 2) AP
2 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Ore. Doctor Expects Release Of At Least 1 Victim | 01:27 A doctor says one victim of the deadly mass shooting at an Oregon community college will likely be released from a Roseburg hospital Friday. (Oct. 2) AP

Alek Skarlatos was supposed to be in class at Umpqua Community College, but was instead doing an interview on "Ellen." VPC
4 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Chris Harper Mercer named as Oregon shooting suspect | 01:13 Police are searching the apartment of Chris Harper Mercer, the suspect in the deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College. 7 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Oregon shooting victim's sister: 'I love him very much' | 02:19 The sister of one of the victims who died in the Oregon college shooting remembers her brother. She wants people to know he was a kind and caring person. VPC

The shooter, who federal authorities identified as 26-year-old Chris Harper Mercer, was killed in a shootout with police. VPC
10 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Students React to Hearing Gunshots on Campus | 00:42 A gunman opened fire inside a classroom in a quiet, rural Oregon town on Thursday, killing nine people before dying in a shootout with police. Nineteen-year-old Hannah Miles was in her writing class when she heard gunshots nearby. (Oct. 1) AP
11 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Alleged Gunman's Father: 'Devastating Day' | 01:00 The father of a man who officials have identified as the Oregon community college gunman says he's as shocked as anybody at the deaths of 10 people including his son. Ian Mercer spoke to reporters in Tarzana, California on Thursday night. (Oct. 2) AP

23 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Sheriff: Shooting is 'Huge Shock' to Community | 01:15 A gunman opened fire at an Oregon community college Thursday, killing at least 13 people before he died during an exchange of gunfire with police, authorities said. (Oct. 1) AP

26 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Oregon Gov: Gunman Dead in College Shooting | 01:21 Oregon Governor Kate Brown says that the gunman in a deadly community college shooting is now deceased and was 20-year-old male suspect. (Oct. 1) AP
27 of 30 10 KILLED BY SHOOTER AT ORE. COMMUNITY COLLEGE Multiple dead in Oregon community college shooting | 00:41 A shooter shot and killed multiple people at an Oregon community college on Thursday. Authorities said the shooter is in custody. Newslook

Doctor Expects Release Of At Least 1 Victim France train hero was supposed to be at Oregon college Chris Harper Mercer named as Oregon shooting suspect Obama urges gun control after Oregon shooting Raw: Vigil For Oregon Shooting Victims Oregon shooting victim's sister: 'I love him very much' Doctor updates condition of Oregon shooting victims 10 dead, 7 hurt in Oregon college shooting Students React to Hearing Gunshots on Campus Alleged Gunman's Father: 'Devastating Day' Vigil held for Oregon shooting victims Sheriff: 10 Dead, Seven Hurt in Oregon Shooting OR shooting police audio: The suspect is down Ore. college student: Teacher told us to duck and hide School shooting witness: It was 'rapid fire' Obama Calls for Gun Reform after Oregon Shooting Obama: Mass shootings have become 'routine' Listen as police respond to shooting at Oregon college Oregon Student: 'We Need to Get Out of Here Now' First accounts of the OR college shooting OR shooting: My friend was gunned down Sheriff: Shooting is 'Huge Shock' to Community Oregon Governor: First responders work 'harrowing' Witness Describes Oregon Shooting Scene Oregon Gov: Gunman Dead in College Shooting Multiple dead in Oregon community college shooting Shooting, Multiple Casualties at Oregon College At Least 10 Dead in Shooting at Oregon College Two of the 10 people initially admitted to Mercy Medical Center after the shooting remain hospitalized, one in critical condition and one in stable condition, Jason Gray, chief medical officer, told reporters Friday. They were among four who underwent operations from gunshot wounds. One of the four has been released, and another was expected to leave the hospital Friday.
Mintz broke both of his legs during the incident but is expected to recover, Earnhardt told KCPQ.
“He's going to have to learn to walk again, but he walked away with his life, and that's more than so many other people did,” Earnhardt told the station.
